subject: Marketing
title: Clustering and Echo Chambers
description: A micro-lesson that makes Clustering and Echo Chambers usable.

hook.text: A political meme can go viral within one party and be invisible to the other.

buildup.text: Social networks form clusters where people share similar views and tastes.

discovery.text: Content can seem viral within a cluster while reaching zero outside it.

twist.text: Marketers mistake echo chamber buzz for mainstream viralityâ€”then are shocked by silence.

climax.text: True virality means crossing cluster boundaries, not just dominating one.

punchline.text: Viral in a bubble is just loud in a small room.

quiz.question: What is a risk of viral content within echo chambers?
options: It may seem viral but reach zero outside the cluster
It always crosses into mainstream audiences
